subclusters.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Oxidative Mutation Accumulation Theory
Protein Oxidation and Glycation Damage Accumulation Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Oxidative Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage causing DNA mutations and decline in DNA repair leading to mutation accumulation driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Oxidative Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genomic DNA damage, mitochondrial DNA mutations, ROS, and decline in repair mechanisms impacting stem cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Oxidative Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights genomic instability, oxidative DNA damage, and loss of proteostasis as central to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Oxidative Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS-induced damage to DNA, proteins, and telomeres and the role of repair systems in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Oxidative Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS causing molecular damage and mitochondrial dysfunction driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Oxidative Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes molecular damage from endogenous and exogenous sources including genotoxic and organellar damage with repair mechanisms modulating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Oxidative Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links DNA damage, oxidative stress, inflammation, and mitochondrial dysfunction as drivers of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Oxidative Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA damage accumulation, genome instability, and DNA repair deficiency as primary aging causes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Oxidative Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes endogenous and exogenous damage including ROS causing DNA mutations and genome instability driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Specifically focuses on accumulation of mitochondrial DNA mutations and defective mtDNA polymerase proofreading causing premature aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mtDNA mutation accumulation, mitochondrial respiratory chain decline, and mitochondrial dysfunction causing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS causing oxidative damage limiting lifespan, mitochondrial defects driving replicative aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Entropic Physicochemical Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on stochastic entropic forces causing molecular damage, cellular heterogeneity, and decline of repair mechanisms due to physicochemical damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Entropic Physicochemical Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes random accumulation of damage from environmental and genetic factors with systemic regulatory decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Entropic Physicochemical Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits progressive molecular and cellular damage accumulation as central dogma of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Entropic Physicochemical Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes stochastic molecular damage accumulation and progressive failure of maintenance and repair mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Entropic Physicochemical Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of cellular and molecular damage, failure of homeostasis, and genome destabilization.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Entropic Physicochemical Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes cumulative molecular damage from metabolic activity and heterogeneous damage forms driving aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Entropic Physicochemical Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on stochastic biomolecular damage accumulation and decline in cellular stress response pathways including autophagy and proteasome.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Entropic Physicochemical Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights early-life accumulation of oxidative protein damage and correlation of stress resistance with lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Entropic Physicochemical Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes progressive accumulation of oxidized, aggregated, and misfolded proteins with decline in repair and maintenance mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Glycation Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses specifically on protein oxidative damage, glycation, AGE accumulation, proteolytic system decline, and protein aggregation driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Glycation Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on accumulation of lipofuscin, a marker of damaged proteins and cellular waste, linked to oxidative stress and impaired degradation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Glycation Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of biological waste including damaged proteins and organelles due to imperfect autophagy and lysosomal degradation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Glycation Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes cigarette smoke accelerating aging by exhausting repair mechanisms and causing accumulation of molecular damage including protein malfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Glycation Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulated damage and wear-and-tear in muscle proteins, autophagy dysregulation, and stress resistance affecting muscle aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Integrated Hallmarks and Nutrient-Sensing Modulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates conserved hallmarks of aging including DNA damage and metabolic dysregulation with nutrient-sensing pathways modulating aging.
